title: World Waterfalls Quiz
description: Dive into questions about the planet's most spectacular waterfalls, from towering cascades to thundering cataracts.

questions.question: Angel Falls, the world's highest uninterrupted waterfall at 979 meters, is located in which country?
Niagara Falls sits on the border between the United States and which other country?
Iguazu Falls, a massive waterfall system with around 275 individual drops, straddles the border of Argentina and which country?
Victoria Falls on the Zambezi River is known locally as 'Mosi-oa-Tunya.' What does this name mean?
Gullfoss, a dramatic two-tiered waterfall and one of Iceland's most popular attractions, gets its name meaning what?
Yosemite Falls, one of the tallest waterfalls in North America, is located in which US state?
Plitvice Lakes National Park, famous for its cascading lakes and waterfalls, is located in which European country?
Kaieteur Falls in Guyana is notable for being the world's largest single-drop waterfall by what measure?
Sutherland Falls, one of the tallest waterfalls in New Zealand, is located on which island?
Dettifoss, one of Europe's most powerful waterfalls, is located in which country?
Ban Gioc-Detian Falls, a transborder waterfall, sits on the border between Vietnam and which country?
Havasu Falls, known for its stunning blue-green water, is located on which Native American reservation?
Tugela Falls, the second-tallest waterfall in the world, is located in which country?
The Rhine Falls, the largest plain waterfall in Europe, is located near which Swiss city?
Seljalandsfoss waterfall in Iceland is unique because visitors can do what?
